reviews.text: Bottle @ Porterhouse Dublin.  Is that sauerkraut, anise, and corn syrup all in one quaff?
Bottle. This is a decent lager with a bit going on in the background - some malt smoothness and balanced hopping. Generally pretty uninteresting though.

I tried this beer in the departure lounge at the Dar es Salam airport.  It was the only place I saw it during my brief stay in Tanzania.  It was a nice departure from the truly horrible East African Pale Lagers I have become accustomed to during my frequent trips int he region.  That being said I would never consider drinking it unless I was stuck in a stifling airport for hours waiting for a flight.Soft copper color, faint aroma of hops and dish soap, and a flavor profile not terrible unlike skunked Strohâs.
